Class OPA

java.lang.Object
schedulingAlgorithm.PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.implementation.OPA
public class OPA extends SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
Optimal Priority Assignment (OPA) for single-core systems.

OPA uses Audsley's algorithm to assign optimal fixed priorities, ensuring that all tasks are schedulable on a single-core system. The algorithm assigns tasks starting with the lowest priority and proceeds until an optimal allocation is achieved. This implementation performs response-time analysis and prints diagnostic messages during the assignment process.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • OPA

      public OPA()
      Constructs a new OPA scheduler instance.

      Initializes the algorithm name to a human-readable label and sets the priority type to fixed because OPA determines a static, optimal priority ordering for a task set.

  • Method Details

    • calculatePriority

      public void calculatePriority(TaskSet ts)
      Assigns fixed, optimal priorities to tasks in the provided TaskSet using Audsley's Optimal Priority Assignment method.

      The method iterates priority levels from lowest to highest and for each level searches for an unassigned task that is schedulable when given that candidate priority. Schedulability checks are performed by isSchedulableWithPriority(TaskSet, Task, int, boolean[]), which runs a response-time analysis. If a suitable task is found it is assigned the current priority; after all levels are processed the tasks in the TaskSet receive their computed Priority objects. Diagnostic messages indicating assignment decisions and final priorities are printed to standard output.

      Specified by:
      calculatePriority in class SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      ts - the TaskSet containing tasks to which optimal fixed priorities will be assigned; must not be null. Each task in the set will have its priority updated in-place.

    • calculatePriority

      public JobQueue calculatePriority(JobQueue jq)
      Job-queue level priority calculation is not supported by OPA.

      OPA targets single-core task sets and assigns fixed priorities at the task level using Audsley's algorithm. This implementation does not provide a job-level priority calculation. Invoking this method will throw UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      calculatePriority in class SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      jq - the JobQueue parameter (not used)
      Returns:
      nothing; this method always throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown because job-queue based priority calculation is not implemented for this algorithm
